summary: The 'Tax Excessive CEO Pay Act of 2025' amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase corporate tax rates based on the ratio of CEO/highest-paid employee compensation to median worker pay. The bill targets companies with ratios greater than 50:1, with the tax increase escalating based on the disparity. It also includes provisions for calculating the pay ratio, exemptions for certain corporations, and other conforming amendments related to this tax change. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025, and directs the Secretary of the Treasury to issue anti-avoidance regulations.
